Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable
    The class GameController is the controller of the game. It has a method selectColor which is called by the view when the player selects the next color. It then computesthe next step of the game, and updates model and view.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController(int size)
        Constructor used for initializing the controller. It creates the game's view and the game's model instances
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the board on which the game will be played

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        resets the game

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Callback used when the user clicks a button (reset, quit, settings, undo or redo)
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - the ActionEvent

      • selectColor

        public void selectColor(int color)
        selectColor is the method called when the user selects a new color. If that color is not the currently selected one, then it applies the laogic of the game to capture possible locations. It then checks if the game is finished, and if so, congratulates the player, showing the number of moves, and gives to options: start a new game, or exit
        Parameters:
        color - the newly selected color

      • flood

        private void flood()
        flood is the method that computes which new dots should be "captured" when a new color has been selected. The Model is updated accordingly

      • shouldBeCaptured

        private boolean shouldBeCaptured(int i,
                                 int j)
        shouldBeCaptured is a helper method that decides if the dot located at position (i,j), which is next to a captured dot, should itself be captured
        Parameters:
        i - row of the dot
        j - column of the dot
        Returns:
        true if the dot should be captured and false otherwise

      • addStates

        private void addStates()
        addStates is a helper method that pushes every GameModel into the undo stack

      • canUndo

        private boolean canUndo()
        canUndo is a helper method that returns true if the user can undo and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if an undo is permitted and false otherwise

      • undo

        private void undo()
        undo is a helper method that restores the game to its previous state when the user presses "Undo" button.

      • canRedo

        private boolean canRedo()
        canRedo is a helper method that returns true if the user can redo and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if an redo is permitted and false otherwise

      • redo

        private void redo()
        redo is a helper method that restores the game to its previous state after the game is undone when the user presses "Redo" button.
